briefing.opening: Hello everyone. We will now begin the climate briefing for December 20, 2025.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Climate Action Achievements and Policy Trends
sections.content: Domestically, various efforts to respond to climate change and achieve carbon neutrality are bearing fruit. aT was awarded the 'Climate Change Response' category at the Consumer ESG Innovation Awards [1], and Gochang County won the Excellence Award at the Climate Energy Awards, proving its status as a leading carbon-neutral city [3, 7]. Furthermore, Kim Su-kang, CEO of Solar Energybility Co., Ltd., was recognized for her contributions in the private sector by winning the 2025 Korea ESG Carbon Neutrality Innovation Grand Prize [5]. In Yeongju, a forum on agricultural development strategies for climate change response was held, and the Ansan Environmental Foundation plans to continue its carbon-neutral specialized project, 'Ecomentor,' next year [2, 4]. Concurrently, the Korea Renewable Energy Organizations Alliance announced its launch in April next year [6], and Assemblyman Kim Min-seok expressed expectations for the Honam region's role in climate change response, noting that AI and renewable energy projects are heading to Jeonnam [8, 9].

sections.title: âš ï¸ International Community Faces Climate Crisis and Direct Impacts
sections.content: The international community is facing direct threats from climate change, and its impacts are widespread. Floods occurred in Washington State, USA [10], and an analysis also revealed that climate change is already negatively impacting Americans' incomes [11]. On Mount Washington's summit, increased crowds and climate change are burdening the environment [14], and climate change phenomena such as heatwaves, cold spells, and pollution have been shown to increase the risk of heart attacks [16]. Notably, alongside warnings that innocent victims of climate change are suffering the most [20], concerns have also been raised that food losses due to crop pests will accelerate due to the climate crisis [21].

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Social Warnings on Failure to Meet Climate Targets
sections.content: Social criticism is growing regarding governments' inaction in achieving the 1.5-degree climate change target. Extinction Rebellion protestors strongly criticized the international community's consistent inaction on the 1.5-degree target and urged action [13, 18, 19]. Meanwhile, Opera Philadelphia performed Vivaldi's 'The Four Seasons,' incorporating warning messages about climate change into its melodies, raising awareness of the climate crisis's severity through art [12]. This demonstrates the spread of various movements aimed at raising awareness of climate change and demanding immediate action.

sections.title: ğŸŒ Global Cooperation and Clean Energy Transition
sections.content: International cooperation and efforts to transition to clean energy to address climate change are also being actively discussed. The necessity for cooperation between the United States and China in various fields, from health to climate change, has been raised in the AI era [15], indicating the importance of solidarity among major nations to solve global climate issues. Meanwhile, California successfully repositioned itself as a clean energy powerhouse, with its clean energy usage reaching an all-time high in 2025 [22]. This transition aligns with the argument that a hidden positive correlation exists between economic viability and climate change, emphasizing the importance of clean energy transition for sustainable development [17].

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlighted the progress in domestic and international climate action, the deepening crisis, and the importance of international solidarity to overcome it. This concludes the climate briefing for December 20, 2025.

summary.phenomenon: Due to climate change, the most vulnerable and innocent victims are suffering the most.

articles.title: â€˜Borrowed timeâ€™: crop pests and food losses supercharged by climate crisis

summary.phenomenon: An analysis reveals that the disruption of food supply by crop pests is accelerating due to the climate crisis, with losses expected to surge.
summary.cause: This is because rising temperatures enable pests to breed and spread more rapidly, while current simplified food systems are already vulnerable.
summary.outlook: Food losses due to crop pests are expected to surge. While the world has largely avoided major impacts until now, it can no longer afford to be complacent, necessitating measures such as crop diversification.

articles.title: â€˜The biggest transformation in a centuryâ€™: how California remade itself as a clean energy powerhouse

summary.phenomenon: In 2025, California (the Golden State) recorded an all-time high in clean energy usage.
summary.outlook: As the Trump administration abandons U.S. climate initiatives, California is projected to fill that void and demonstrate leadership in the clean energy sector.
